item.title: Purpleteam at Alpha
item.description: Where has Kim been for the last couple of years? This post explains why he’s been so quiet and what he has been working on.

item.title: Who Devs Wins
item.description: Twelve Jade Development Teams go head-to-head in the Jade Secure Coding Tournament

item.title: Workshop - Init Security Titans
item.description: Workshop to initialise, train and deploy the Jade Security Champions across the Jade Development Teams.

item.title: Talk - Hardening Your Docker Infrastructure
item.description: The security defaults of Docker are designed to get you up and running (“just work”) quickly, rather than being the most secure. There are many default configurations that can be improved upon. In this talk Kim will walk through improving the security of Docker hosts, containers, networking and deployments.

item.title: Talk - Security Regression Testing on OWASP Zap Node API
item.description: The OWASP ZAP HTTP intercepting proxy is useful for manually attacking your Web apps and APIs. Now, we have the official Node API to programatically drive ZAP to regression test our creations. Kim will show you how to build a fully featured security regression testing CLI, consumable by your CI/nightly builds.

item.title: purpleteam
item.description:
Automated security regression testing of your web applications and APIs, no setup required.

1. Write test conditions -> convert to Cucumber
2. Provide minimal configuration
3. Consume node CLI package
4. Run single command purpleteam test
Perfect for your CI/nightly build

item.title: Cloud Security
item.description: Discussion about Kim’s new book on Cloud Security, some of the content, and links to other useful resources around securing your Cloud environments.

item.title: Cloud Security - Quick Reference
item.description: Are you looking to achieve a good understanding of your responsibilities as well as your CSPs responsibilities to make sure your security stature in the Cloud is where you need it to be? Do you need the technical direction required to create your secure Cloud environment? You can think of this book as your technical Cloud consultant.

item.title: Development Team Security Teardown $995NZ + GST
item.description:
We can provide insight into potential issues/defects that are not obvious with your Development Team(s):
• Development Process
• System Being Developed
Our Teardown can provide the needed visibility in order to make the improvements.

item.title: Workshop - Building Security Into Your Development Teams
item.description: Kim’s flagship Software Developer focussed training, this time at OWASP New Zealand Day conference.

item.title: Docker Security - Quick Reference
item.description: Are you looking to improve the security of your Docker deployments? Do you want to confirm you haven’t missed any important security aspects in your Docker infrastructure?

item.title: Development Team Security Roadmap $2995NZ + GST
item.description:
Too many security defects in your Development Team(s) deliverables?
External security reviews too costly?

Let us create a security roadmap for your Development Team(s).

item.title: Security Strategy Retainer $3495NZ + GST
item.description: Our agreement entitles you to unlimited 1 on 1 access to Kim via phone, SMS, email, Slack, Skype, Signal, etc. Participation is limited to 10 people. Fee is for four months.

item.title: Building Security into Your Development Teams (workshop) $495 + GST per student
item.description: Full Day Interactive Workshop focussing on building security into your Development Team(s).

item.title: Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description:
A three part book series focused on lifting the security knowledge of Software Developers, Engineers, and their teams, so that they can continuously deliver secure technical solutions on time and within budget, without nasty surprises.

First book is complete, second book is content complete and currently in technical review.

item.title: Zane Lackey on Application Security
item.description: Zane Lackey talks with Kim Carter about Application Security on Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Pre Conference Interview
item.description: All Day DevOps Live! Interview with All Day DevOps speaker, Kim Carter. Kim will be speaking about the “Secrets of a High Performance Security Focused Agile Team”.

item.title: Workshop - Building Security Into Your Development Teams
item.description: Kim’s flagship Software Developer focussed training, this time at Christchurch Hacker Conference (CHCon).

item.title: Haroon Meer on Network Security
item.description: Haroon Meer talks with Kim Carter about network security on Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Workshop - Web Developer Quiz Night
item.description: Attacking a set of carefully curated questions around info-sec, white hat, black hat, attack and defense.

item.title: Diogo Mónica on Docker Security
item.description: Diogo Mónica talks with Kim Carter about Docker Security on Software Engineering Radio.

item.title: Kim's Career Story
item.description: Charles Max Wood interviews Kim Carter to find out more about his journey into programming and information security!

item.title: Talk - The Art of Exploitation
item.description: At JS Remote Conf: Kim examines and demonstrates a collection of essential attacks, commonly used in the exploitation and demise of many individuals and organisations today.

item.title: Talk - The Art of Exploitation
item.description: At NZ.JS: Kim examines and demonstrates a collection of essential attacks, commonly used in the exploitation and demise of many individuals and organisations today.

item.title: OWASP New Zealand Day
item.description:
The ninth conference of its kind.

Dedicated to information security, with an emphasis on secure architecture and development techniques to help Kiwi developers build more secure applications.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers - Intense
item.description: Kiwicon hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: At AWS Auckland, Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: NodeJS Auckland: Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: This time in Kilkenny of Ireland, Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Computer Science Students
item.description: This time for the students of University of Canterbury. An exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective. Based on the content of volume 0 & 1 of Kim’s new book “Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers”. This time held at the University of Canterbury.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: This time in New York City at OWASP, Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: Hackers On Planet Earth (HOPE) conference in New York City. An exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural, engineering and penetration testing perspective. Based on the content of volume 0 & 1 of Kim’s new book “Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers”.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat at the meetup he usually facilitates, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Security Regression Testing with ZapAPI and NodeGoat
item.description: At CHC.js Kim will demonstrate the OWASP Zap API with NodeGoat, which helps you identify vulnerabilities in your web application as you create it, rather than at the end of a project.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: AusCERT hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Workshop - Tools, Password Profiling, Brute Forcing
item.description: Kim will take ISIG through the collection of tools added and configured on his penetration testing machine used throughout his book series (Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers). Kim will then profile a well known celebrities password, creating a short-list, then (on-line) brute force their login. Come along, it’ll be fun.

item.title: Development Team Security Implementation
item.description:
Your Development Team(s) are struggling to create secure software. Your business is paying too much for security reviews, and penetration testing at the end of the project.

Your customers want to be certain that their personal data is secure. You could be saving significant expenditure on security and software development in general.

item.title: Security Review, Penetration Testing
item.description:
You need to be sure that what your development team(s) are creating is going to withstand the onslaught of those tasked with breaking your deliverables, and stealing your customers data.

Your customers want to be certain that their personal data is secure. You need your product to stand-up to those that are going to attack it.

item.title: InfoSec for Developers
item.description: Carl and Richard talk with Kim Carter about his experience in helping developers grasp information security and successfully employ it within their teams.

item.title: Captcha Considerations
item.description: Lack of captchas are a risk, but so are captchas themselves…

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: Kiwicon hands-on threat modelling, attack and defence strategy training for Web Developers wishing to understand their attackers better, stay ahead of them and create cost effective defence strategies.

item.title: Talk - Password Profiling, Brute Forcing
item.description: Kim talks with his fellow Toastmasters about profiling peoples passwords and then brute forcing web applications with the shortlist of guessed passwords..

item.title: Talk - 0wn1ng The Web
item.description: At WDCNZ: Kim discusses and demonstrates how JavaScript can be used for good and evil.

item.title: Workshop - Holistic Info-Sec for Web Developers
item.description: At CampJS, Melbourne, Australia: Join Kim in the exploration into an insightful set of steps he has learned, from an architectural perspective down to the zeros and ones. Also providing insights of how attackers of your systems think.

item.title: Talk - What's Our Software Doing With All That User Input
item.description: At OWASP NZ Day: What are we doing with all the characters that get shoved into our applications? Have we considered every potential execution context?

item.title: Workshop - Security Testing with Kim Carter
item.description: At ANZTB: Hands-on insight into security testing. Kim will discuss some of the more common security vulnerabilities being found in today’s software implementations, and will demonstrate ways of testing them.

item.title: Sanitising User Input from Browser part 2
item.description:
Redirects to legacy blog post.

Untrusted data (data entered by a user), should always be treated as though it contains attack code. This data should not be sent anywhere without taking the necessary steps to detect and neutralise the malicious code.

item.title: Sanitising User Input from Browser part 1
item.description:
Redirects to legacy blog post.

I was working on a web based project recently where there was no security thought about when designing, developing it. The following outlines my experience with retrofitting security. It’s my hope that someone will find it useful for their own implementation.
